revised_title: Microscopic Analysis of Rocks from the Andes of Ecuador
tldr: The author examines rock samples collected from the Andes of Ecuador by E. Whymper. They focus on the rocks from Pichincha, a dormant volcano, and analyze their microscopic structure. The author describes various minerals and rock types found in the samples, providing insights into the geological history of the region. This study contributes to the understanding of the Andes' volcanic activity and the formation of rocks in the area.
